attributes.action: reject the proposed 20mph speed limit as the replacement for the current 30mph roads
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Bringing the speed limit down to 20mph would cause more congestion on our roads, make journey times longer, and cause more carbon emissions due to travelling in a lower gear as a result. Buses would run even slower, which would not be a good move if the government want to encourage us to use public transport.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "reject the proposed 20mph speed limit as the replacement for the current 30mph roads."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12579.asp

Prime Minister's Office
